image.altText: Hand holding a mobile phone with the Cigno app showing words: Why choose Cigno?

props.synopsis: ASIC transcripts, obtained exclusively by the ABC, reveal one of Australia's most persecuted payday lending operations targeted 'any consumer and every consumer'.

title.children: Inside the interrogation room with a former rugby star turned key player in one of Australia’s most persecuted payday lending operations

image.altText: A logo on a vehicle reads "Queensland police".

props.synopsis: Queensland police say emergency services were called to a caravan park where they found a 24-year-old man with a stab wound.

title.children: Girl charged with murder over alleged stabbing at caravan park

image.altText: GettyImages-2166225862

props.synopsis: Jessica Hull has come on in leaps and bounds over the past 12 months, going from an also-ran at major championships to being an Olympic silver medallist.

title.children: Jess Hull's meteoric rise to a Paris Olympics silver is the result of unwavering determination and endurance

image.altText: GettyImages-2166039926

props.synopsis: Australia's chef de mission says criticism of breaker Raygun has been disappointing, as her Paris Olympics performance continues to go viral.

title.children: 'I absolutely love her courage': Meares defends Raygun after wave of online ridicule for Paris performance

image.altText: Two men in suits stand in front of the Australian flag, with one speaking and the other looking at him

props.synopsis: ASIO told the newly elected Albanese government in mid-2022 to lower Australia's national terror alert level to "possible", but Labor stalled on the advice for almost half a year before enacting it.

title.children: Labor stalled for months on lowering terror alert level after ASIO recommendation in 2022

image.altText: An elderly man sits in a chair amid rubble.

props.synopsis: Local authorities say the air strike targeted displaced people sheltering in a school in the Daraj district of eastern Gaza during dawn prayers.

title.children: Around 100 Palestinians killed in Israeli air strike on school in Gaza, local authorities say

image.altText: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris

props.synopsis: A well-funded lobby group has been spending millions on US election races to punish Democrats who don't toe the line on Israel.

title.children: The pro-Israel lobby came for 'the Squad' — and sent a message to Kamala Harris

image.altText: Two boys lug sacks of rice on their shoulders.

props.synopsis: For more than two months, the only way to get food, medicine and other supplies into Porgera has been to carry them by foot over a huge cascade of rocks left by a landslide.

title.children: Kids isolated by a fatal PNG landslide are going to bed hungry and many have dropped out of school

image.altText: DSC06537 copy

props.synopsis: For most of his life, rock star Nick Cave says he was 'in awe of his own genius'. Cataclysmic life events fundamentally "re-arranged" him.

title.children: The moment that ended Nick Cave's 'disgraceful self-indulgence'

image.altText: Australia players stand and smile

props.synopsis: How you respond to missing out is just as important as how you respond to success. On that measure alone, these Aussie Stingers are true champions.

title.children: Stingers meet success and failure with the same, indomitable spirit

image.altText: Eliud Kipchoge runs in the pack

props.synopsis: Arguably the greatest marathon runner in history, Eliud Kipchoge, could not claim a third straight Olympic title, pulling out of the race won by Ethiopia's Tamirat Tola.

title.children: Father Time catches up with marathon's greatest runner as Eliud Kipchoge pulls out of marathon

image.altText: A composite image of Nina Kerridge, a boy jumping with a ball and lots of people squished together dressed in blue.

props.synopsis: From the loudest burp to reciting the alphabet backwards in the least time … it might be unorthodox but you just may have what it takes to be a world champion.

title.children: Got Olympic fever but no sporting ability? A Victorian couple helps everyday Aussies break bizarre records

image.altText: Kingaroy Hospital exterior

props.synopsis: A witness praises hospital staff for "putting themselves in between" patients and a man who was allegedly armed with a knife and then shot by police at a Kingaroy hospital.

title.children: Police shooting witness praises hospital staff for protecting patients from allegedly armed man

image.altText: Freshwater crocodile floats atop a clear lake during the middle of the day

props.synopsis: The freshwater crocodile found in an artificial lake near the outback Queensland town leaves residents scratching their heads after evading wildlife officers and surviving freezing temperatures.

title.children: Freshwater crocodile dubbed 'Houdini of Hughenden' for evading capture

image.altText: A man standing behind a building.

props.synopsis: Manufacturing once played a critical role in the Australian economy but now makes up less than 6 per cent of the nation's GDP. So why is the government trying to revive it now?

title.children: Almost two decades ago, Peter was made redundant at Holden. Now the government wants a future made in Australia

image.altText: Flames surround the firing of a missile from a military ship

props.synopsis: In a move the federal government said added to the Royal Australian Navy's "long-range strike capability", HMAS Sydney has fired a Standard Missile 6 in a military exercise near Hawaii.

title.children: Royal Australian Navy fires long-range missile in military exercise off Hawaii

image.altText: Premier Steven Miles delivering the state of the state address

props.synopsis: Queensland's premier made a bold statement in a major speech this week, vowing he would leave no stone unturned ahead of the state election and issuing a challenge to the opposition leader.

title.children: Will Labor's petrol promise spark a turnaround or just fuel the LNP's momentum?

image.altText: A 4WD stuck in a deep gully as a winch is raced ahead by a man.

props.synopsis: From the harshest terrain to creeks of muddy water, welcome to one of the toughest competitions around, the Winch Truck Racing Games.

title.children: It's not Paris but these properties are hosting an extreme four-wheel-driving 'Olympics'

image.altText: Penny Wong wears a maroon blazer as she speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong has rebuked a senior Israeli minister who suggested it "might be just and moral" to starve Palestinians in Gaza until hostages held by Hamas are returned.

title.children: Penny Wong condemns Israeli minister’s comments that Gazan starvation may be justified

image.altText: A young couple embrace happily inside their new home, surrounded by moving boxes.

props.synopsis: Even though you may not have introduced your new partner to all your friends and family — if you live together, the ATO wants you to declare it on your tax return.

title.children: Not married or engaged? The ATO says your live-in partner counts as a spouse

image.altText: Composite image of Kaylee McKeown and sailor Matt Wearn with their gold medals at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Swimmer Kaylee McKeown and sailor Matt Wearn both made history at the Paris Olympics. Now, they've been named as Australia's flag-bearers at the closing ceremony.

title.children: Kaylee McKeown and Matt Wearn return to Paris to carry Australian flag in closing ceremony

image.altText: Alysha Newman

props.synopsis: As critics hit out at what they believe is a broken financial model, some athletes — including Paris medal winners — are turning to OnlyFans to keep the money coming in.

title.children: 'Akin to modern-day slavery': With Olympic funding in a dire situation, athletes are turning to OnlyFans to fund their dreams

image.altText: A split image shows Andrew Forrest smiling and Gina Rinehart in red hat

props.synopsis: Gina Rinehart and Andrew Forrest are billionaires who made their fortunes in mining. Now, the long-time rivals are going toe-to-toe in apparel, buying up some of Australia's most iconic brands. But this foray into fashion is about more than boots.

title.children: 'It's a way of buying influence': The billionaires acquiring Australia's most iconic brands

image.altText: Susan Wojcicki

props.synopsis: Susan Wojcicki was at the helm at YouTube for nine years, before which she held various positions at Google including being its first marketing manager and helping with the platform's creation.

title.children: Susan Wojcicki, influential tech figure who led growth of Google and YouTube, dies aged 56

image.altText: Rohingya refugee women queue for food aid

props.synopsis: The reported attack, estimated to have killed about 150 people, would be one of the deadliest incidents involving civilians in the country's ongoing civil war.

title.children: Ethnic armed group in Myanmar suspected of deadly attack on Rohingya Muslims

image.altText: A building on fire

props.synopsis: Fighting in the Kursk region of Russia continues and video shared by Ukranian media show troops in control of a Russian town.

title.children: Russia reinforces Kursk region as video shows evidence of Ukrainian 'invasion'

image.altText: Sheikh Hasina behind a bouquet.

props.synopsis: Long-time Bangladeshi leader Sheikh Hasina is ready to face trial back home after fleeing to New Delhi on Monday, her son Sajeeb Wazed says.

title.children: 'The threat of arrest has never scared my mother': Hasina's son says former Bangladesh PM to return for trial

image.altText: Mikael Wolfe with distinctive tattoos.

props.synopsis: The salesman promised to "make men huge" and send their "sex drive through the roof". Then he disappeared with their money.

title.children: 'Gobsmacked': An army of ripped off men found this testosterone peddler was not who he seemed

image.altText: A mural graffiti shows a cartoonish monkey head with its mouth open in shock.

props.synopsis: Thousands of long-tail macaques are following increasingly aggressive ringleaders into attacks on tourists and schoolkids, and now they're wising up to the "Anti-Monkey Unit's" tactics, leaving the town no choice but to try and round them up before they storm another police station.

title.children: Rival monkey gangs terrorise Thai city, mugging and assaulting schoolkids and tourists

image.altText: An auction sign in front of a house

props.synopsis: Despite the practice being against the law, new figures from Fair Trading NSW obtained by ABC News, shows reports of underquoting are on the rise.

title.children: A Sydney house sold for $600k above the price guide. It's just one example of a big problem

image.altText: Young couple Erin and Jack stand in their living room near a window

props.synopsis: Rapidly growing house prices and sluggish wage growth means many young people have given up on the idea of ever becoming home owners, with Erin and Jack saying they've "got no hope" for a place of their own.

title.children: Priced out of home ownership, could an entire generation be stuck renting forever?

image.altText: A slice of cinnamon sugar cake on a plate with the larger cake in the background. It's topped with icing and cut doughnuts.

props.synopsis: Ella Rossanis's simple cinnamon sugar cake comes together in one bowl. Make it more indulgent with optional — but highly recommended — cream cheese icing.

title.children: A one-bowl cinnamon sugar cake inspired by doughnuts

image.altText: Springboks players come together in an embrace after scoring a try against the Wallabies

props.synopsis: Winger Kurt-Lee Arendse scored two tries as South Africa matched their biggest ever win over the Wallabies on Australian soil with a 33-7 victory.

title.children: World champion Springboks hammer Wallabies in Brisbane

image.altText: A woman holding a camera

props.synopsis: When she first picked up a camera, Jess Allan loved taking pictures of landscapes and animals. Now the photographer portrays her elders' stories through her images.

title.children: Outback photographer's insights into culture and country that 'an outsider could never capture'
